metadata.synopsis: Drow Wizard that has some info about the Adamantine Furnace.Paranoid after being petrified by the spectator.narrative feature: Used to kill his oponents and interrogate them afterwards (Disguise Self + Speak With Dead).
metadata.how_to_trigger: repro steps: 1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. god on4. goto 112.431; 50.914; -249.5525. CTRL-Shift-K spectator (and hook horror if included in combat)6. Dialog starts automatically

6.speaker: Petrified Drow
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spitting in between words, enraged

87.speaker: Petrified Drow
87.text: I offer to parley, and he brings a spectator? Twit. Quite ruined my ambush.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: Accustomed to a little more respect from a male.

118.speaker: Petrified Drow
118.text: ... my apologies, mistress. I am still coming back to my senses.

119.speaker: Petrified Drow
119.text: We simply haven't time for all of my titles.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I'm more concerned with this 'twit' who set a spectator on you.

69.speaker: Petrified Drow
69.text: Pah. A rival - a mere footnote to my legend. You should be more concerned with who I am.

116.speaker: Petrified Drow
116.text: I am Dhourn. Third son of House Ba'Tol, first rank evoker, and initiate of Gravenhollow's...
116.context: CinematicNodeContext: Trailing off at end as he reaches into pocket (off-screen)NodeContext: Trailing off at end as he reaches into pocket (off-screen)

60.speaker: Petrified Drow
60.text: ... oh. Oh no no my dear dark GODS BELOW, NO!
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding up a crystal in mute horror, its light shining dim

108.speaker: Narrator
108.text: *A memory shard. A container onto which brief mental impressions are projected, and stored for years at a time.*

112.speaker: Player
112.text: It's fading - it seems you've been frozen like that for a while.

14.speaker: Petrified Drow
14.text: Far, far longer than I realised.

82.speaker: Petrified Drow
82.text: Then my enemies have already found the forge. Which bastard stole my glory - Xargrim? Filro?
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Places memory shard back in his back pocket

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Neither bastard rings a bell, I'm afraid.

93.speaker: Petrified Drow
93.text: The Adamantine Forge?  If it had been found, the name would ring throughout the Underdark.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: I haven't the slightest idea what you're talking about.

58.speaker: Petrified Drow
58.text: Impossible. The master of the Adamantine Forge would be known - and feared - throughout the Underdark.

63.speaker: Petrified Drow
63.text: Unless... hah. Hah! The fools must have turned back. Or better yet, died in the search. Good.

136.speaker: Petrified Drow
136.text: If they had just surrendered their research to me, we might have found the forge together.

88.speaker: Petrified Drow
88.text: But no - they hoarded their knowledge, left each of us clinging to scraps.

147.speaker: Petrified Drow
147.text: I had the good sense to lock mine away in the memory shard. And now I can claim the forge alone.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: You'll claim nothing. Hand over the crystal - I'll take it from here.

148.speaker: Petrified Drow
148.context: NodeContext: Furious at the suggestion, remembers he's talking to his betters

48.speaker: Petrified Drow
48.text: I mean to say, mistress - I have undertaken this research myself, beholden to no house or hold.
48.context: NodeContext: Continuing more diplomatically, through gritted teeth

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Every house is beholden to Lolth - as every male is beholden to their betters.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: I must have misheard you. Perhaps you'll speak louder from a rack in Menzoberranzan.

0.speaker: Petrified Drow
0.text: Forgive me... mistress. I would of course be honoured to pass my research onto you.

123.speaker: Petrified Drow
123.text: The memory shard answers to the pass-phrase 'Dhourn, Lord Archmage'.

101.speaker: Petrified Drow
101.text: This memory shard holds the location of the lost Adamantine Forge. It answers to the pass-phrase 'Dhourn, Lord Archmage'.

22.speaker: Petrified Drow
22.text: ... I... rather infuriatingly, I seem to have lost it. Should you locate it, the knowledge within can be unlocked with the pass-phrase 'Dhourn, Lord Archmage'.

79.speaker: Petrified Drow
79.text: ... just an... aspiration for a wizard of my talents, mistress.
79.context: NodeContext: Delicate dignity, but absolutely mortified.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I'm above house politics myself - but I'll still kill for what I want.

20.speaker: Petrified Drow
20.text: I've already been made a living statue for this damn crystal. A little pain will not deter me.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: HAND IT OVER, BOY. OR ELSE.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: House Ba'Tol, you said? You'll be welcomed back - all the male heirs died, I believe.

76.speaker: Petrified Drow
76.text: ... then my brothers have perished in my absence? With no sons to replace them...

137.speaker: Petrified Drow
137.text: Just an... aspiration, mistress. But if my house now has room to honour me as I deserve, I have no need to chase relics any longer.

140.speaker: Petrified Drow
140.text: Take the shard, then - it holds the location of the lost Adamantine Forge. It answers to the pass-phrase 'Dhourn, Lord Archmage'.

95.speaker: Petrified Drow
95.text: Take the shard then, please- only... I seem to have lost it.

49.speaker: Petrified Drow
49.text: Hah, just as my fortunes turn for the better. Rather lucky for me - less so for you, mistress.

38.speaker: Petrified Drow
38.text: But should you find it, mistress - the pass-phrase is 'Dhourn, Lord Archmage'. A rather... aspirational title, I know - but no longer needed.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: What knowledge does the crystal contain, exactly?

97.speaker: Petrified Drow
97.text: Bold of you to ask. The others knew of the forge's defences, its operation... but I know where to find it.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: It sounds like you were each as bad as the other.

138.speaker: Petrified Drow
138.text: Does it? Then I'll be sure to give my telling a little polish for the history books.

80.speaker: Petrified Drow
80.text: I have plenty of time, now I'm the only one hunting for the forge. Or... almost the only one.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Perhaps we can claim the forge together, split the proceeds.

31.speaker: Petrified Drow
31.text: Enterprising of you - the others knew of the forge's defences, its operation... but I am the only one who knows its location.

109.speaker: Petrified Drow
109.text: You proved your power in freeing me - but I need no more rivals. Try to take this as a compliment, yes?

156.speaker: Player
156.text: 'Alone'? Don't you still need your rivals' research?

43.speaker: Petrified Drow
43.text: They knew of the forge's defences, its operation, true enough. But I know its location.

34.speaker: Petrified Drow
34.text: The rest I can figure out with time, now I am the only one searching. Or... almost the only one.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: Do you speak of the Adamantine Forge? It's still hidden, as far as I know.

83.speaker: Petrified Drow
83.text: Impossible. My rivals would have stopped at nothing.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Xargrim's dead. His body's rotting in a myconid circle.

115.speaker: Petrified Drow
115.text: Truly? Excellent - he might actually serve some purpose feeding fungus.

102.speaker: Petrified Drow
102.text: We were friends once, three of us working together to find a lost wonder. Until the others grew jealous, began to guard their secrets.

27.speaker: Petrified Drow
27.text: By any chance... did you find anything of interest on dear Xargrim's corpse?

126.speaker: Player
126.text: He had this manual on him.

100.speaker: Petrified Drow
100.text: So the bastard was hiding something. Trust Xargrim to require instructions.

71.speaker: Petrified Drow
71.text: I'll put them to better use. And, on the off chance you've read them yourself...

41.speaker: Petrified Drow
41.text: Well. This knowledge is only useful so long as I am the only one who holds it. My apologies.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Just a book. He had some particular literary tastes.

105.speaker: Petrified Drow
105.text: Xargrim had no taste at all. But enough low cunning to use an illusion? Absolutely.

55.speaker: Petrified Drow
55.text: And you fell for it. You clearly don't have the intellect to pose a threat... but you did  manage to kill a spectator.

32.speaker: Petrified Drow
32.text: I simply cannot suffer another rival in this. So killing you is a compliment, if you think about it.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: You're asking if I robbed your friend?

121.speaker: Petrified Drow
121.text: If you didn't, you're a fool. The dead have no use for what's in their pockets.

35.speaker: Petrified Drow
35.text: In fact - you've served your purpose now, so allow me to demonstrate.

129.speaker: Petrified Drow
129.text: Disappointing. But he's out of the way, so small blessings I suppose.

151.speaker: Petrified Drow
151.text: Well. I have some business I am long overdue in completing, and I'm sure you have... something to do.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Wait. I'll take that crystal of yours as thanks.

40.speaker: Petrified Drow
40.text: ... you were so very close. If only you had just a little less cheek, I might have let you live.

8.speaker: Petrified Drow
8.text: Hmm. Perhaps you are telling the truth. Perhaps not.

89.speaker: Petrified Drow
89.text: I believe I'll have to kill you and ask again.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: Not your concern. Hand over your research - I'll take over from here.

150.speaker: Player
150.text: Xargrim's dead. His body's rotting in a myconid circle.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Filro went mad. I had to kill him.

81.speaker: Petrified Drow
81.text: Consider it mercy - or pest control. Filro was never fully right.

106.speaker: Petrified Drow
106.text: Did he have anything...  interesting in his possession?

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Some text - but it's written in code.

86.speaker: Petrified Drow
86.text: You release me and hand-deliver such a prize? I ought to keep you.

39.speaker: Petrified Drow
39.text: But I'm afraid I can't. You've proven a little too resourceful, and I really can't suffer another rival for this prize.

42.speaker: Petrified Drow
42.text: So try to take this as a compliment, yes?

96.speaker: Player
96.text: I decoded his notes - he'd written about some guardian of the Adamantine Forge.

17.speaker: Petrified Drow
17.text: Well now. It seems his rather unique mind made itself useful. Clever of you to see through his cypher.

139.speaker: Petrified Drow
139.text: A little too clever. I'd rather not lose one rival only to have another sprout in his place.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Filro's gone mad. He joined a pack of hook horrors.

94.speaker: Petrified Drow
94.text: Truly? Perhaps they've improved his manner.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: The Adamantine Forge? That was me, actually.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I was exploring across the lake.

53.speaker: Petrified Drow
53.text: ... do you know how many years we spent searching? Studying? For you to simply stumble on it?

11.speaker: Petrified Drow
11.text: Gods. Gods. I might have to raise your corpse just so I can kill you twice.

72.speaker: Petrified Drow
72.text: Why indeed. I think I'll find you easier to speak to once you're a corpse.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Do you speak of the Adamantine Forge? It's still hidden, as far as I know.

54.speaker: Petrified Drow
54.text: A memory shard. They hold their glow for years - and it's fading.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: All right. I'll let you get back to whatever this is.

28.speaker: Petrified Drow
28.text: You don't understand. A memory shard ought to hold its glow for years - and look at it! It's fading.

66.speaker: Petrified Drow
66.text: It contains knowledge that is precious to me. If it has grown this dull...

130.speaker: Petrified Drow
130.text: ... my crystal. My memory shard. Where is it?
130.context: NodeContext: Rising panic as he can't find an item we stole from him.

18.speaker: Petrified Drow
18.text: You think it clever to steal from a statue, do you?
18.context: NodeContext: To us, with suspicion and fury

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Ah, you must be the one Xargrim battled.

75.speaker: Petrified Drow
75.text: 'Battled'? Please - that implies rivalry. He will but a footnote in my legend.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. You're welcome for the rescue.

142.speaker: Petrified Drow
142.text: Rescue. Helpless babes are rescued. I allowed you to assist me.

13.speaker: Petrified Drow
13.text: Not to sound ungrateful, but you couldn't have saved some of my guards? I'm left to carry my own luggage.

16.speaker: Petrified Drow
16.text: We'll be moving, just as soon as my guards are done moaning.

37.speaker: Petrified Drow
37.text: I bid you luck at the forge. All that labour - not fitting for Dhourn, first son of House Ba'Tol.

133.speaker: Petrified Drow
133.text: Away. I must gather my strength and free my companions here. I'm not going to carry my own luggage.

154.speaker: Petrified Drow
154.text: Respectfully - you have already taken my life's work. What else could you possibly need?
